page.title: 11Clubs and Recreation
page.content: The original building o f the Parish Hall was carried out by Mr. Jim Edwards of Tetchill, but there has been various alterations and extensions in later years. There are lots of activities which take place in the hall. They have a bowling green which is used by the bowling club, tennis courts for the tennis club, snooker tables, a football pitch, and a small playground with swings and a slide for children. The hall itself is hired for parties, weddings, cheese and wine evenings and various other occasions. Bingo every Friday is important to villagers. The W.I. meet at the hall every second Tuesday in the month. There is alsoa luncheon club for the old aged pensioners which meets every other
